questions.title: Two Sum
questions.description:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. 

 You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. 

 You can return the answer in any order.

| Test Cases | nums                | Target | Expected Output   | Notes                                |
|------------|----------------------|--------|-------------------|--------------------------------------|
| 1          | [2, 7, 11, 15]        | 9      | [0, 1]            | Normal case, straightforward         |
| 2          | [3, 2, 4]             | 6      | [1, 2]            | Same number appears after            |
| 3          | [3, 3]                | 6      | [0, 1]            | Need to use the same value twice (different indices) |
| 4          | [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]    | 10     | [3, 5]            | Larger array                         |
| 5          | [0, 4, 3, 0]          | 0      | [0, 3]            | Zero handling                        |
| 6          | [-3, 4, 3, 90]        | 0      | [0, 2]            | Negative numbers                     |
| 7          | [1, 5, 1, 5]          | 10     | [1, 3]            | Duplicate numbers in array           |
| 8          | [2, 7, 11, 15]        | 26     | [2, 3]            | Sum of large numbers                 |
| 9          | [1, 2, 3]             | 7      | None/Error        | No solution case (if allowed)        |
| 10         | [5]                   | 5      | None/Error        | Single element array, invalid case   |

questions.title: Check for Duplicates
questions.description:
Description: Check if any value appears at least twice.

| Test Cases | nums               | Expected Output | Notes                                |
|------------|--------------------|-----------------|--------------------------------------|
| 1          | [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1] | True            | The value '1' appears twice          |
| 2          | [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]    | False           | No duplicates present                |
| 3          | [3, 3, 3, 3]       | True            | The value '3' appears multiple times |
| 4          | [0, -1, 2, -1]     | True            | Negative numbers are included        |
| 5          | [10, 20, 30]       | False           | No duplicates in a small list        |

example.explanation: The value '1' appears twice in the list.
